content: This article **needs additional citations for verification**. Please help improve this article by adding citations to reliable sources. Unsourced material may be challenged and removed. *Find sources:* "Scouting and Guiding in Singapore" – news **·** newspapers **·** books **·** scholar **·** JSTOR *(September 2014)* *(Learn how and when to remove this message)* The **[Scout](/wiki/Scouting) and [Guide](/wiki/Girl_Guides) movement in [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore)** is served by - [Girl Guides Singapore](/wiki/Girl_Guides_Singapore), member of the [World Association of Girl Guides and Girl Scouts](/wiki/World_Association_of_Girl_Guides_and_Girl_Scouts) - [The Singapore Scout Association](/wiki/The_Singapore_Scout_Association), member of the [World Organization of the Scout Movement](/wiki/World_Organization_of_the_Scout_Movement) ## International Scouting units in Singapore In addition, there are American Boy Scouts in Singapore, serving in Cub Scout Pack 3017 and Boy Scout Troop 07, chartered by the American Association of Singapore, and Boy Scout Troop 102, chartered by the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-Day Saints. These groups are organized under the Direct Service Center in Irving, Texas, USA. [Scouts et Guides de France](/wiki/Scouts_et_Guides_de_France) is also active in Singapore. - [Singapore Scout Association](/wiki/Singapore_Scout_Association) - [Girl Guides Singapore](/wiki/Girl_Guides_Singapore) - [Cub Scouts (Singapore Scout Association)](/wiki/Cub_Scouts_(Singapore_Scout_Association)) - Scouting portal - Singapore portal This Singapore-related article is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it. - v - t - e This [Scouting or Guiding](/wiki/Scouting) article is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it. - v - t - e
title: Scouting and Guiding in Singapore
